intro: Centaurea virescens, commonly known as green centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with a yellow center, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea virescens is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
